unit_learning_outcomes.description: Investigate, analyse and synthesise complex information, problems, concepts and theories in relation to the impact of insolvency generally on a corporation's rights and liabilities
Appraise the development and the operation of personal and corporate insolvency law and how it has evolved in a wider social, economic and international context
Apply relevant rules and principles to resolve complex legal problems dealing with insolvency.
Evaluate the effectiveness of insolvency law in resolving issues of bankruptcy and corporate insolvency.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: reading and problem solving prior to tutorials
Study and research for the final assessment

enrolment_rules.description: (Admission to JD and 80cp in LAWS or LAW units at 6000 level or above) or (admission to LLM or MITCL)

assessments.assessment_title: A final time limited take home assessment
assessments.description: This final assessment will test student's knowledge of the whole of the course content
Students will be required to present an independent research essay of 3000 words examining a contemporary aspect of insolvency law

data.description: This unit covers the law and practice relating to the insolvency of corporations. The unit examines the potential consequences of insolvency for the individuals who ran the business and the rights and obligations of employees, creditors and other parties linked to the business or its officers.
data.title: Insolvency Law

title: Insolvency Law
